results.title: Do it yourself cartoon kit
results.brief_description: A satire on cartoons, home hobbyists, and box-top specials, in which the viewer is offered an animation kit, complete with noises, cut-out characters and stick-anything adhesive glue, all for fifty guineas and three detergent box tops. Very much in the Monty Python style - made by Keith Learner, Nancy Hanna, Bob Godfrey and Vera Linnecar.

results.title: Do it his way: a case for adapted intelligence tests
results.brief_description: Children with handicaps are often placed at a distinct disadvantage by most intelligence tests. This film advocates adapting tests to fit the needs of a child’s handicap so that true abilities can be measured. Psychologist Zola Anderson modifies psychological testing procedures to fit the abilities of a six-year-old child with cerebral palsy and a four-year-old child with mild mental retardation.

results.title: Do detectives think?
results.creator_credit: Hal Roach, Hal Roach Studios, Pathé Frères and Fred Guiol
results.brief_description: An escaped convict (Young) is out to kill the judge (Finlayson) who sentenced him. Two inept detectives (Laurel & Hardy) are hired to guard the judge.

results.title: DNA: molecule of heredity
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology Program. Unit 5. Heredity and Adaptive Change”.
Dr. George Beadle, discoverer of DNA and Nobel prize winner, explains why DNA, a giant molecule of the cell chromosomes, is the basis of growth and reproduction and the mechanism for transporting hereditary specifications from one generation to the next.

results.title: Divorce and young people
results.creator_credit: Golden Coast Film Productions and Nick Vincent
results.brief_description: Depicts some of the most common fears, conflicts and problems that children face when their parents are going through divorce and demonstrates certain methods of coping with the various emotions that arise. Offers solutions to the problems that children find most difficult to solve in a divorce situation.

results.title: Divorce = Li Hun [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Beijing Film Studio and Wang Haowei
results.brief_description: Set in Beijing in the early thirties, “Li Hun” recounts the cultural conficts faced by a well-natured match-maker caught between Chinese tradition and the Western ideas of marriage and family that are beginning to take hold amongst his friends. Adapted from the original work by the famous drama writer Lao She. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Divorce
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Family Life Transitions in Marriage”.
Examines the impact of divorce on both children and adults. Uses the case study of a fictional family to show the problems, adjustments, and critical issues involved when couples decide to get a divorce.

results.title: Division (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
The partitive and measure aspects of division are introduced when a group of children discuss two sharing situations and begin to make a wall chart. The program changes direction near the end to show children applying the four operations they have considered, to find as many ways of writing “6” as they can discover.
